oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Nutrient losses from organic and conventional crop rotations - a case study on fine sand soil
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Turtola, Eila
Lemola, Riitta
Esala, Martti
Kiljala, Janne
Joki-Tokola, Erkki
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Air and water emissions
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: P and N losses were highest from the conventional crop rotation. The losses were most affected by single management practices. The four-year study is, however, too short for soil derived, long-term differences to come fully out in the leaching losses.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Turtola, Eila; Lemola, Riitta; Esala, Martti; Kiljala, Janne and Joki-Tokola, Erkki (2003) Nutrient losses from organic and conventional crop rotations - a case study on fine sand soil. Paper at: NJF's 22nd congress "Nordic agriculture in global perspective", Turku, Finland, July 1-4, 2003.
